snippet: The persistence of “insider attacks” has prompted NATO and Afghan military leaders to try to find ways to decrease violence against coalition forces.
abstract: Persistence of violence by Afghan security force members on their international counterparts prompts both NATO and Afghan military leaders to try to drill down into the circumstances surrounding each incident and determine the cause in order to decrease them; two more attacks brings to 29 the number of insider attacks in 2012.

byline.contributor: Habib Zahori and an employee of The New York Times contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The persistence of “insider attacks” has prompted NATO and Afghan military leaders to try to find ways to decrease violence against coalition forces.

headline.seo: Ways Sought to End Attacks by Afghans on Coalition
headline.main: End Sought to Attacks on Allies by Afghans
headline.print_headline: End Sought To Attacks On Allies By Afghans
